title: Connecting the Dots: Network Analysis for Organisational Value
notes:
Connecting the Dots: Network Analysis for Organisational Value
Saturday, 3:15pm-4:15pm
Open science, Floor 9 - 902  
https://app.mozillafestival.org/#_session-523

Session slides! (follow along at home)  https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/16wKvaquVPqUNA-CzjBKuejJ0E7uBmSOZnchPWhFqPZQ/edit?usp=sharing 

Agenda
	1. Who are we? Why are we here?
	1. Hands-on demo: understand what a network graph is & how you can build them using offline or digital tools.
	1. Introduction to the principles of network evaluation.
	1. Recap! Catch-up!
	1. Examples of different methodological approaches to network evaluation using two parallel projects running at TES Global & Mozilla earlier this year.
	1. Where you can go to learn more...
	1. What did we learn?  What will we do?

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
What are your goals for this session?
	* To learn what networks actually are
	* Sam (@samueledyson) To broaden my thinking about networks and how to strengthen them
	* Caitlin (@caitiewrites) Understand what kinds of questions other organisations have about networks & how to evaluate them & what other strategies people are applying in this space.
	* [add more...]
	* 
	* 
	* 
	*  

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Based on the session, what have you been able to take away with you and apply?
	* How I can use networks for my own work
